018package org.tquadrat.foundation.ap;
019
020import static java.lang.reflect.Proxy.isProxyClass;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_STRING;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.DebugOutput.ifDebug;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
026
027import javax.annotation.processing.Messager;
028import javax.annotation.processing.ProcessingEnvironment;
029import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationMirror;
030import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationValue;
031import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
032import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
033import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
034import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
035import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
036import javax.tools.Diagnostic;
037import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
038import java.util.List;
039import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
040import java.util.Optional;
041import java.util.Set;
042import java.util.StringJoiner;
043
044import org.apiguardian.api.API;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
046
047/**
048 *  The specification for a set of helpers for annotation processing.
049 *
050 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
051 *  @version $Id: APHelper.java 1030 2022-04-06 13:42:02Z tquadrat $
052 *  @since 0.1.0
053 *
054 *  @UMLGraph.link
055 */
056@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: APHelper.java 1030 2022-04-06 13:42:02Z tquadrat $" )
057@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
058public interface APHelper extends Messager, ProcessingEnvironment
059{
060        /*---------*\
061    ====** Methods **==========================================================
062        \*---------*/
063    /**
064     *  <p>{@summary Returns the flag that indicates whether some debug
065     *  information should be emitted to the generated code.}</p>
066     *  <p>The value is controlled by the value of the annotation processor
067     *  option
068     *  {@value APBase#ADD_DEBUG_OUTPUT}.</p>
069     *
070     *  @return {@code true} if the debug information should be added,
071     *      {@code false} if not.
072     */
073    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
074    public boolean addDebugOutput();
075
076    /**
077     *  Retrieves the
078     *  {@link AnnotationMirror}
079     *  for the given annotation
080     *  from the given
081     *  {@link Element}
082     *  instance. Only declared annotations are considered, not the inherited
083     *  ones.
084     *
085     *  @param  element The element.
086     *  @param  annotationClass The annotation to look for.
087     *  @return An instance of
088     *      {@link Optional}
089     *      that holds the found {@code AnnotationMirror} instance.
090     *
091     *  @see Element#getAnnotationMirrors()
092     */
093    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyLongLambda" )
094    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationMirror> getAnnotationMirror( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass )
095    {
096        final var isProxyClass = isProxyClass( requireNonNullArgument( annotationClass, "annotationClass" ) );
097        ifDebug( a -> "annotationClass = %s".formatted( ((Class<?>) a [0]).getName() ), annotationClass );
098        final String annotationClassName;
099        if( isProxyClass )
100        {
101            final var interfaces = annotationClass.getInterfaces();
102            ifDebug( interfaces.length > 1, i ->
103            {
104                final var joiner = new StringJoiner( ", ", "annotation interface: ", EMPTY_STRING );
105                //noinspection SuspiciousArrayCast
106                for( final var c : ((Class<?> []) i) )
107                {
108                    joiner.add( c.getName() );
109                }
110                return joiner.toString();
111            }, (Object []) interfaces );
112            if( interfaces.length != 1 )
113                throw new AnnotationProcessingError( format( "annotationClass proxy '%s' implements more than one interface" ) );
114            annotationClassName = interfaces [0].getName();
115        }
116        else
117        {
118            annotationClassName = requireNonNullArgument( annotationClass, "annotationClass" ).getName();
119        }
120        ifDebug( "effective annotationClassName = %s"::formatted, annotationClassName );
121        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getAnnotationMirrors().stream()
122            .filter( m -> m.getAnnotationType().toString().equals( annotationClassName ) )
123            .findFirst();
124        ifDebug( retValue.isEmpty(), e ->
125        {
126            final var joiner = new StringJoiner( ", ", "annotationMirrors: ", EMPTY_STRING );
127            for( final var mirror : ((Element) e [0]).getAnnotationMirrors() )
128            {
129                joiner.add( mirror.getAnnotationType().toString() );
130            }
131            return joiner.toString();
132        }, element );
133
134        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
135        return retValue;
136    }   //  getAnnotationMirror()
137
138    /**
139     *  Retrieves the annotation value from the given annotation mirror.
140     *
141     *  @param  annotationMirror    The annotation mirror.
142     *  @return An instance of
143     *      {@link Optional}
144     *      that holds the found annotation value.
145     */
146    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationValue> getAnnotationValue( final AnnotationMirror annotationMirror )
147    {
148        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, "value" );
149
150        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
151        return retValue;
152    }   //  getAnnotationValue()
153
154    /**
155     *  Retrieves the annotation value with the given name from the given
156     *  annotation mirror.
157     *
158     *  @param  annotationMirror    The annotation mirror.
159     *  @param  name    The name of the desired value.
160     *  @return An instance of
161     *      {@link Optional}
162     *      that holds the found annotation value.
163     */
164    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationValue> getAnnotationValue( final AnnotationMirror annotationMirror, final String name )
165    {
166        final var elementValues = getElementUtils().getElementValuesWithDefaults( annotationMirror );
167        @SuppressWarnings( "unlikely-arg-type" )
168        final var retValue = elementValues.keySet().stream()
169            .filter( k -> k.getSimpleName().toString().equals( name ) )
170            .map( elementValues::get )
171            .findAny();
172
173        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
174        return retValue;
175    }   //  getAnnotationValue()
176
177    /**
178     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves a
179     *  {@link TypeMirror}
180     *  instance from an annotation.}</p>
181     *  <p>In case an annotation defines a
182     *  {@link Class Class&lt;?&gt;}
183     *  attribute, the value for that attribute is either {@code null} or
184     *  something strange, but never an instance of {@code Class<?>}. So
185     *  we need some special code to get something useful from the
186     *  annotation.</p>
187     *  <p>This implementations assumes the default name
188     *  &quot;{@code value}&quot; for the attribute.</p>
189     *
190     *  @param  element The annotated element.
191     *  @param  annotationClass The type of the annotation.
192     *  @return An instance of
193     *      {@link Optional}
194     *      that holds the {@code TypeMirror}
195     *      instance.
196     *  @throws NoSuchElementException  The given element is not annotated with
197     *      an annotation of the given type.
198     */
199    public default Optional<TypeMirror> getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass )
200    {
201        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( element, annotationClass )
202            .orElseThrow( () -> new NoSuchElementException( annotationClass.getName() ) );
203
204        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror )
205            .map( annotationValue -> (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
206
207        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
208        return retValue;
209    }   //  getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue()
210
211    /**
212     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves a
213     *  {@link TypeMirror}
214     *  instance from an annotation.}</p>
215     *  <p>In case an annotation defines a
216     *  {@link Class Class&lt;?&gt;}
217     *  attribute, the value for that attribute is either {@code null} or
218     *  something strange, but never an instance of {@code Class<?>}. So we
219     *  need some special code to get something useful from the annotation.</p>
220     *
221     *  @param  element The annotated element.
222     *  @param  annotationClass The type of the annotation.
223     *  @param  attributeName   The name of the attribute that holds the class.
224     *  @return An instance of
225     *      {@link Optional}
226     *      that holds the {@code TypeMirror}
227     *      instance.
228     *  @throws NoSuchElementException  The given element is not annotated with
229     *      an annotation of the given type.
230     */
231    public default Optional<TypeMirror> getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass, final String attributeName )
232    {
233        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( element, annotationClass )
234            .orElseThrow( () -> new NoSuchElementException( annotationClass.getName() ) );
235
236        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, attributeName )
237            .map( annotationValue -> (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
238
239        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
240        return retValue;
241    }   //  getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue()
242
243    /**
244     *  Checks whether the given element has the given annotation.
245     *
246     *  @note If the retention for the given annotation is not
247     *      {@link java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy#RUNTIME RUNTIME}
248     *      it could have been removed from the element in an earlier compile
249     *      run.
250     *
251     *  @param  <A> The type of the annotation.
252     *  @param  element The element to inspect.
253     *  @param  annotationType  The type of the annotation to look for.
254     *  @return {@code true} if the element is annotated with the given
255     *      annotation, {@code false} if not.
256     *
257     *  @see java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy#RUNTIME
258     */
259    public default <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation( final Element element, final Class<A> annotationType )
260    {
261        final var annotation = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getAnnotation( requireNonNullArgument( annotationType, "annotationType" ) );
262        final var retValue = annotation != null;
263
264        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
265        return retValue;
266    }   //  hasAnnotation()
267
268    /**
269     *  Determines whether the given instance of
270     *  {@link TypeMirror}
271     *  is for an
272     *  {@link Enum}
273     *  type.
274     *
275     *  @param  type    The type to check.
276     *  @return {@code true} if the given type is an {@code Enum} type,
277     *      {@code false} otherwise.
278     */
279    public boolean isEnumType( final TypeMirror type );
280
281    /**
282     *  {@inheritDoc}
283     */
284    @Override
285    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg )
286    {
287        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg );
288    }   //  printMessage()
289
290    /**
291     *  {@inheritDoc}
292     */
293    @Override
294    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element )
295    {
296        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element );
297    }   //  printMessage()
298
299    /**
300     *  {@inheritDoc}
301     */
302    @Override
303    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element, final AnnotationMirror annotation )
304    {
305        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element, annotation );
306    }   //  printMessage()
307
308    /**
309     *  {@inheritDoc}
310     */
311    @Override
312    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element, final AnnotationMirror annotation, final AnnotationValue value )
313    {
314        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element, annotation, value );
315    }   //  printMessage()
316
317    /**
318     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the names of a method's arguments.}</p>
319     *  <p>This method will return the names of the arguments as defined only
320     *  if the compiler flag {@code -parameters} is set; otherwise, the
321     *  arguments are just counted ({@code arg0}, {@code arg1}, {@code arg2},
322     *  …).</p>
323     *
324     *  @param  method  The method.
325     *  @return The names of the arguments.
326     */
327    public List<Name> retrieveArgumentNames( final ExecutableElement method );
328
329    /**
330     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the generic types for the given type.}</p>
331     *
332     *  @param  type    The
333     *      {@link TypeMirror} instance to inspect.
334     *  @return The type arguments the given type was defined with; will be the
335     *      empty list if that type was not generic.
336     */
337    public List<? extends TypeMirror> retrieveGenericTypes( final TypeMirror type );
338
339    /**
340     *  Retrieves the interfaces are that implemented or extended by the given
341     *  type element.
342     *
343     *  @param  typeElement The type element to inspect.
344     *  @param  interfaces  The already retrieved interfaces.
345     */
346    public default void retrieveInterfaces( final TypeElement typeElement, final Set<? super TypeElement> interfaces )
347    {
348        interfaces.add( typeElement );
349
350        for( final var typeMirror : typeElement.getInterfaces() )
351        {
352            final var nextInterface = (TypeElement) getTypeUtils().asElement( typeMirror );
353            if( !interfaces.contains( nextInterface ) )
354            {
355                retrieveInterfaces( nextInterface, interfaces );
356            }
357        }
358    }   //  retrieveInterfaces()
359}
360//  class APHelper
361
362/*
363 *  End of File
364 */
